<@U00> uploaded a file: <https://prospelaautumn1.slack.com/files/U7CQMS6N4/F7MAS3DMG/weekly_opportunities_bulletin_2017-10-16__1_.docx|Weekly Opportunities Bulletin 2017-10-16 (1).docx> and commented: Team, I've come across this very useful doc for apprenticeships and other ad hoc ops between school and full time work (e.g. 12 month up-skilling programmes). 

If your mentee could be interested in these avenues this might come in handy. It covers anything from becoming an air traffic controller to going into the music industry. 

Hope this helps! :monkey_face:
D

<@U00> commented on <@U00>’s file <https://prospelaautumn1.slack.com/files/U7CQMS6N4/F7MAS3DMG/weekly_opportunities_bulletin_2017-10-16__1_.docx|Weekly Opportunities Bulletin 2017-10-16 (1).docx>: PS: Let us know if there's anything in particular that might be useful for you or if you're struggling with something - we'll do our best to support!

I think an important point to add for students is how to get an internship. Ask, ask, ask! Ask your parents to help you organise one, ask their friends and see if there are any officially listed online. Often a recommendation can get you into the door :-)

text: Everyone, feel free to add your own option to this with "+Add Option"

Yes definitely worth asking. The challenge for some of our students may also be that their parent & friend networks have a limited variety of jobs and/or jobs they're not interested in. 

One of my previous mentees mentioned their only feasible approach to get an internship was cold calling companies(!), which isn't something many people, let alone students will do :sweat_smile: That was a confident kid! :laughing:

I now tell my mentees that being a "yes" man/woman is a good approach when you're first starting out. Get every bit of experience you can and then little by little you make your way to something more substantial. e.g. my first experience was on a fruit & veg stall shouting out "All for a £1!!!"  :the_horns: That experience got me a contact who helped me get my 2 week school internship within business mgt of a banana factory lol :bowtie:
